item.title: South Africa vs Pakistan Live Score: Pakistan score after 12 overs is 56/1 | Mint - Mint
item.description:
South Africa vs Pakistan Live Score: Pakistan at 120/2 after 25 overs

Date & Source: 22 Dec 2024, 08:49:25 PM IST

South Africa vs Pakistan Live Score updates from the 3rd ODI of the Pakistan tour of South Africa. Pakistan has reached 120 runs for the loss of 2 wickets after 25 overs.

  • Corbin Bosch makes his ODI debut for South Africa.
  • Power play 1 (1-10): Pakistan 42/1.
  • Pakistan reached 50/1 in 11.3 overs.
  • The 1st wicket partnership was 50 off 69 balls between Saim Ayub (35 runs) and Babar Azam (19 runs).
  • As of 25 overs, Saim Ayub remains unbeaten on 58 runs, while Mohammad Rizwan has scored 2 runs.

"OUT! Babar Azam is out! Caught by David Miller off the bowling of Kwena Maphaka."

Overall, the match is closely contested with solid performances from the Pakistani batsmen.

item.title: South Africa vs Pakistan Live Score: It’s a Four. Pakistan at 33/1 after 8.2 overs | Mint - Mint
item.description:
South Africa vs Pakistan Live Score: Pakistan at 56/1 After 12 Overs

Date: 22 Dec 2024
Source: Live Match Coverage

Live updates from the ongoing ODI match between South Africa and Pakistan, highlighting critical moments of the innings.

  • Pakistan scored 56 runs for the loss of 1 wicket after 12 overs.
  • Saim Ayub is the leading scorer for Pakistan with 36 runs off 37 balls.

Saim Ayub smashed a six and a few fours during his innings, displaying great form.

This match is part of the 3rd ODI series of the Pakistan tour of South Africa. Stay tuned for more updates!

item.title: Smriti Mandhana Scripts History, Becomes First-Ever Woman Cricketer To... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Smriti Mandhana Scripts History, Becomes First-Ever Woman Cricketer To...

Publication Date: December 22, 2024 Source: NDTV

Stylish opener Smriti Mandhana extended her impressive form with a 91 off 102 balls, leading India to a strong total in the first Women's ODI against the West Indies.

  • Mandhana recorded 50-plus scores for the fifth straight innings.
  • She became the first-ever woman to score over 1600 runs in a calendar year.
  • The match featured a robust batting display, contributing to India's 314/9.
  • Zaida James from the West Indies was the standout bowler with five wickets.
“Smriti Mandhana (2024) - 1602 runs, the highest ever scored by a woman in a calendar year.”

This performance highlights Mandhana's remarkable talent and contributions to women's cricket, breaking significant records in the sport.

item.title: Sanju Samson Reveals Why Rajasthan Royals Went For 13-Year-Old Vaibhav Suryavanshi - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Sanju Samson Reveals Why Rajasthan Royals Went For 13-Year-Old Vaibhav Suryavanshi

Date: December 22, 2024 | Source: NDTV Sports

The IPL 2025 auction saw a remarkable moment with the bid for 13-year-old batting talent Vaibhav Suryavanshi, marking him as the youngest player ever auctioned in IPL history. Rajasthan Royals captain Sanju Samson shared the rationale behind this significant decision.

  • Suryavanshi was sold to Rajasthan Royals for Rs 1.1 crore.
  • He impressed with a hundred against Australia in U19, viewed by RR's decision-making team.
  • Following the auction, he excelled at the ACC Men's U19 Asia Cup with an average of 44.
  • He is set to break multiple records, including being the youngest-ever player in IPL if he plays in 2025.
  • Samson emphasized RR's history of nurturing young talent into champions, citing examples like Yashasvi Jaiswal.
“Rajasthan Royals have a history of doing this. They find out talents and make them champions.” - Sanju Samson

As Rajasthan Royals prepare for IPL 2025, they are guided by renowned coach Rahul Dravid, aiming to balance winning with developing future cricket stars.

item.title: Boxing Day Test: How Shubman Gill stood out differently from other Indians at Melbourne nets on Sunday - The Indian Express
item.description:
Boxing Day Test: How Shubman Gill stood out differently from other Indians at Melbourne nets on Sunday

Date: December 22, 2024 | Source: The Indian Express

Shubman Gill showcased a unique batting approach during the practice sessions at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG), differing from his Indian teammates by constantly altering his stance based on the bowlers.

  • Gill varied his stance significantly, positioning himself differently depending on the bowler.
  • He practiced with both throwdown specialists and regular bowlers, adapting his approach for each type of delivery.
  • Other players, including Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, displayed more traditional batting styles, but Gill's variability stood out.
  • Despite the challenges of the poor pitch quality at the nets, Gill managed to adjust effectively.
“All in all, an interesting training day at the MCG nets, in particular in the way Gill went about his batting.”

item.title: Sunil Gavaskar's Unflinching Message As Virat Kohli Struggles For Form - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Sunil Gavaskar's Unflinching Message As Virat Kohli Struggles For Form

Date: May 5, 2024 | Source: NDTV

As Virat Kohli faces challenges in his batting performance during the ongoing tour to Australia, former Indian cricket great Sunil Gavaskar has provided crucial advice aimed at reviving Kohli's confidence.

  • Kohli has struggled with deliveries outside off-stump, leading to repeated dismissals.
  • Gavaskar suggests Kohli revisit his old playing videos to understand his approach during successful innings.
  • Gavaskar emphasized the importance of the cover drive in Kohli's batting, which has historically yielded him success.
  • He encourages Kohli and captain Rohit Sharma to reflect on their best innings to regain confidence.
“You don't score X thousand runs in international cricket and get that many hundreds unless you know how to approach and build a Test innings.” - Sunil Gavaskar

The insights from Gavaskar highlight the need for Kohli to adapt and focus on his strengths, particularly during challenging phases of his career.

item.title: Joe Root returns to ODI fold for Champions Trophy - Cricbuzz
item.description:
Joe Root returns to ODI fold for Champions Trophy

Published on: Sun, Dec 22, 2024, 10:50 AM | Source: Cricbuzz

Joe Root has returned to the England ODI fold for the first time post the 2023 World Cup as he was named in the 15-man squad for the upcoming Champions Trophy.

  • Root was not considered for ODI cricket after England's poor World Cup performance where he scored only 276 runs.
  • Ben Stokes was not selected due to a hamstring injury.
  • Mark Wood and Jofra Archer lead a strong pace attack in the squad.
  • The same squad will also compete in a five-match T20I series.
“Brendon McCullum's first series as all-format head coach sees the veteran's return to the squad.”

The squad aims for strong performance in the upcoming ODIs and T20Is in India starting January 22.

item.title: Team India nets ft. epic one-liners from Rohit Sharma, Jasprit Bumrah and Rishabh Pant - The Times of India
item.description:
Team India nets ft. epic one-liners from Rohit Sharma, Jasprit Bumrah and Rishabh Pant

Publication Date: MELBOURNE

Source: Times of India

The Indian cricket team showcased their fun side during a nets session in Melbourne, highlighted by witty exchanges between players such as Rohit Sharma, Jasprit Bumrah, and Rishabh Pant. Their humorous banter not only entertained themselves but also engaged the spectators present.

  • Rohit Sharma impressed with his quick reflexes, pulling a bouncer from Mohammed Siraj and sharing his insight on it.
  • Bumrah playfully interacted with the openers, offering words of encouragement while putting pressure on them.
  • The atmosphere was jovial, with players like Rohit and Jasprit keeping the mood light with humorous comments.
  • Rishabh Pant joined in the fun, humorously commenting on the challenges presented by Bumrah during practice.
  • The team displayed camaraderie and positivity, making for a lively practice session at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.
“Na batsman [batter] ko match mai ready hone dete ho, na practice mein,” - Rishabh Pant commenting on the intensity of practices.

Overall, India's nets session was a mix of hard work and laughter, setting a positive tone for their upcoming matches.

item.title: Rohit Sharma uses baseball bat in unique training drill as pressure builds on out-of-form India captain before MCG Test - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rohit Sharma uses baseball bat in unique training drill as pressure builds on out-of-form India captain before MCG Test

Date: Dec 22, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Indian captain Rohit Sharma engaged in a unique training drill using a baseball bat to enhance his batting technique in preparation for the crucial Boxing Day Test against Australia.

  • Rohit has struggled with form, scoring only 19 runs in three innings of the series.
  • The Test series is tied at 1-1, making the upcoming match crucial for India.
  • Rohit was seen with an ice pack on his knee during training, raising concerns about potential injury.
  • His struggles extend beyond this series, with only 153 runs in 13 innings since mid-2024.
  • Virat Kohli's performance is also under scrutiny as he aims for a comeback in the upcoming Test.
“As the Indian skipper, Rohit’s form is critical, and he knows that he needs to find his rhythm to help steer his team to victory.”

In conclusion, with pressure mounting, Rohit Sharma’s unique training methods highlight his determination to return to form and lead his team effectively in the upcoming Test.

item.title: Joe Root returns for England's Champions Trophy campaign - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Joe Root Returns to England's ODI Squad for Champions Trophy

Publication Date: January 12, 2024

Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Joe Root has been recalled to England's ODI squad for the ICC Champions Trophy and the upcoming series against India. This decision marks a significant shift in strategy under coach Brendon McCullum.

  • Root, currently the No. 1-ranked Test batter, hasn't played ODIs in over a year.
  • He scored below his career average during the last ODI World Cup in India.
  • The squad includes eight players from the Test team, aiming for a unified approach between formats.
  • Ben Stokes misses out due to injury concerns.
  • England's ODI against India is scheduled for February 6, 2024.
“I am excited about the opportunities ahead and ready to contribute to the team.” - Joe Root

The recall of Root indicates a strategic focus on experience as England prepares for the Champions Trophy amidst changes in their squad dynamics.

item.title: Border-Gavaskar Trophy: What is Boxing Day Test and India's record in it? - The Times of India
item.description:
Border-Gavaskar Trophy: What is Boxing Day Test and India's record in it?

Date: Not specified

Source: Times of India

The Border-Gavaskar Trophy's fourth Test between India and Australia takes place at the iconic MCG, where both teams face issues with batting performance and team structure.

  • The Boxing Day Test is a historic cricket event starting December 26 at the MCG.
  • India has a mixed record in Boxing Day Tests, with 4 wins, 8 losses, and 2 draws in 14 matches.
  • Ajinkya Rahane led India to a significant victory in 2020, overcoming a prior low point with a remarkable performance.
  • Both teams are currently struggling with batting inconsistencies in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy series.
“That triumph, amid injuries and absences of key players, remains one of India’s finest cricketing tales.”

As the match approaches, India seeks to address batting vulnerabilities for a vital performance in this storied fixture.

item.title: Indian, Australian media divided over Ravindra Jadeja press conference incident, leading to boycott of friendly match - Firstpost
item.description:
Australian Media Outraged Over Hindi Post-Match Conference by Ravindra Jadeja, Journalist Match Canceled

Publication Date: December 21, 2024 | Source: Firstpost

The recent Test series between Australia and India has been marred by turmoil both on and off the field, highlighted by a recent press interaction with Indian player Ravindra Jadeja that was conducted solely in Hindi, causing outrage among Australian media.

  • The Australian media expressed anger after Jadeja conducted a press conference in Hindi, refusing to answer questions in English.
  • This incident arose amidst tensions following a altercation between Virat Kohli and an Australian journalist at the Melbourne airport.
  • The Australian press termed the conference as disorganized, reflecting on the state of media relations.
  • A friendly cricket match between Indian and Australian journalists was subsequently canceled due to the fallout from this incident.
“Pressure is intensifying on India ahead of the Boxing Day Test with the tourists adopting a siege mentality.” — 9News Melbourne

The contrasts in media approach could lead to heightened emotions and stakes in the upcoming Boxing Day Test match.

item.title: 'Not sending D Gukesh to school was tough call,' says mother Padma Kumari - The Times of India
item.description:
Not sending D Gukesh to school was tough call,' says mother Padma Kumari

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Unknown

In a heartfelt statement, Padma Kumari, mother of chess prodigy D Gukesh, reflects on her challenging decision to keep her son away from school to focus on his chess training.

  • Padma Kumari expresses her emotional struggles regarding the decision.
  • She emphasizes the importance of supporting her son's career in chess.
  • The decision was made to help Gukesh pursue his passion and talent in chess.
  • The family faced societal pressure regarding education and career choices.
“It was a tough call, but I believe in his potential.”

This decision highlights the sacrifices some families make in pursuit of excellence in sports.

item.title: PV Sindhu to marry fiance Venkata Datta today in Udaipur - The Times of India
item.description:
PV Sindhu to Marry Venkata Datta Today in Udaipur

Publication Date: Today, Source: Times of India

This article covers the marriage of Indian badminton star PV Sindhu to her fiancé Venkata Datta, which is taking place in Udaipur today. The event is highly anticipated among fans and the media.

  • The wedding ceremony is set to occur in a lavish setting in Udaipur.
  • Family and close friends are expected to attend the event.
  • Sindhu's popularity as an athlete brings significant media attention to the wedding.
“We are overwhelmed with joy and are looking forward to this special day.” – PV Sindhu

The couple is known for their private relationship, making this public celebration particularly noteworthy.

item.title: Samson set for big IPL sacrifice for Dhruv Jurel, keeps youngster's Test future in mind: 'Where he is at his career...' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Samson Set for Wicketkeeping Sacrifice for Jurel Ahead of IPL 2025

Date: Dec 22, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Rajasthan Royals captain Sanju Samson has announced that he will share wicketkeeping duties with Dhruv Jurel in IPL 2025 to support Jurel's prospects as a Test player.

  • Samson will for the first time lead without solely keeping wickets.
  • Dhruv Jurel is viewed as a Test wicketkeeping option for India.
  • Samson aims to ensure that the team dynamics remain a priority.
  • Both players have been retained for IPL 2025, with Jurel valued at INR 14 crore.
  • Samson's recent performance includes three T20I centuries.
  • Jurel is currently part of India's Test squad for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
"...we feel for the players... Dhruv, I totally understand from where you come from... Nothing should affect the team; the team comes first..." - Sanju Samson

This decision reflects the Royals' commitment to developing young talent while maintaining team integrity in the upcoming season.

item.description:
Sameer Rizvi: The Right-Handed Suresh Raina Utilizing MS Dhoni's Tips

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Sameer Rizvi, known for his exceptional batting skills, is drawing inspiration from MS Dhoni's techniques to enhance his game and dominate bowlers.

  • Sameer Rizvi is being compared to former cricketer Suresh Raina for his batting style.
  • He is actively using strategies provided by MS Dhoni to improve his performance on the field.
  • Rizvi aims to become a prominent figure in cricket through discipline and hard work.
“Learning from the best is the key to success in cricket.”

Rizvi's commitment to excellence is evident as he seeks mentorship from Dhoni to refine his cricketing skills.

item.title: Aronian echoes Carlsen's views on classical chess after Gukesh's World Championship win: 'Don't want to see the weaker player...' - Firstpost
item.description:
Aronian echoes Carlsen's views on classical chess after Gukesh's World Championship win: 'Don't want to see the weaker player...'

Published on: December 18, 2024 Source: Firstpost

American Grandmaster Levon Aronian has aligned himself with Magnus Carlsen's opinion on classical chess, suggesting that it may not be the best way to crown a world champion.

  • Gukesh recently won the World Chess Championship, sparking renewed debate on the classical format.
  • Carlsen stated classical chess is “probably the worst way” to determine a champion, favoring rapid chess as a truer test of skill.
  • Aronian pointed out that well-trained lower-ranked players can often draw against top players, which diminishes excitement for fans.
  • He drew parallels between chess and other sports, noting how rule changes can affect the excitement and competitiveness of a game.
"So basically if we train a guy like this, he will be able to, let's say 80% of the time to make a draw against a top 10 player. That’s not what we want to see as chess fans." - Levon Aronian

In conclusion, both Aronian and Carlsen advocate for a reevaluation of classical chess in how champions are determined, suggesting innovations in the format might be necessary to maintain the sport's excitement and integrity.

item.title: West Indies bowl; India hand debut to Rawal - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
West Indies Opt to Bowl; India Debuts Pratika Rawal

Date: Recent
Source: ESPN Cricinfo

In the first ODI at the newly opened BCA Stadium in Kotambi, West Indies chose to bowl first against India, with captain Hayley Matthews making the call. India, looking to recover from a recent loss in Australia, has debuted Pratika Rawal in their lineup.

  • West Indies won the toss and opted to bowl.
  • India captain Harmanpreet Kaur returns to the lineup after injury.
  • Pratika Rawal receives her first ODI cap and will open with Smriti Mandhana.
  • India's bowling attack consists of three specialist seamers and two spinners.
  • Deandra Dottin makes her ODI comeback after reversing her retirement.
“West Indies have a poor record against India, winning just five of 26 ODIs.”

This match marks an important step for both teams as they prepare for the upcoming World Cup, aiming to improve their standings in ODI competitions.

item.title: Ravindra Jadeja-Hindi Press Conference Row Leads To 'Cancellation Of A Match': Report - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Ravindra Jadeja-Hindi Press Conference Row Leads To 'Cancellation Of A Match': Report

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: NDTV

The controversy surrounding Ravindra Jadeja's press conference has led to the cancellation of a T20 match planned between media personnel from India and Australia.

  • The controversy erupted after Jadeja spoke only in Hindi during the press conference.
  • Some Australian media alleged that he avoided answering questions in English.
  • This led to a boycott of the press match scheduled for December 24.
  • India's media team denied any refusal to speak in English.
“Jadeja was asked questions in Hindi, and he decided to answer them in Hindi.”

The fourth Test between India and Australia is set to begin on December 26 at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

item.title: Virat Kohli called 'bully' in scathing attack by Australian media, fumed at for 'berating' reporter over airport row - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Virat Kohli Called 'Bully' by Australian Media Following Airport Incident

Date: Dec 22, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Former India captain Virat Kohli has been criticized by Australian media for an altercation with a female journalist at an airport in Melbourne. The incident occurred upon his arrival for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series.

  • Kohli confronted a Channel 7 reporter after she captured images of him with his family, expressing his displeasure.
  • He urged the reporter to delete the images of his children, which led to a backlash from media personalities.
  • Australian reporter Tony Jones labeled Kohli a 'bully' for his treatment of the female reporter.
  • The fourth Test match of the series is set to begin on December 26, currently tied at 1-1.
“You’re nothing but a bully, Virat.” — Tony Jones

The recent incident has sparked widespread discussion regarding celebrity privacy and media behavior.

item.title: Rohit Sharma can still be extremely dangerous at No. 6: Ravi Shastri - The Times of India
item.description:
Rohit Sharma can still be extremely dangerous at No. 6: Ravi Shastri

Publication Date: Not provided
Source: Times of India

Former India cricketer Ravi Shastri has shared his thoughts on Rohit Sharma's batting position in the Border-Gavaskar series against Australia, emphasizing the need for Sharma to adapt and regain his form.

  • Rohit Sharma's recent scores have been disappointing since moving to No. 6.
  • Ravi Shastri supports KL Rahul as the opener after his impressive innings.
  • Shastri suggests Sharma should utilize an aggressive mindset akin to his performance in white-ball cricket.
  • Rohit has experience batting at No. 6 and previously excelled in this role.
  • The importance of attacking play and confidence is emphasized for Rohit to succeed at this position.
“I would like to see Rohit Sharma, his tactics change a bit because he can still be extremely dangerous at that number (six).” - Ravi Shastri

This commentary highlights the strategic adjustments Sharma must undertake to leverage his potential and contribute significantly to the team.
